alert.note: Alert for Blount; Jefferson; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:26PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Walker, southwestern Blount and north central Jefferson Counties through 100 PM CDT... At 1226 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sipsey, or near Sumiton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sumiton, Dora, Warrior, Kimberly, Trafford, Hayden, Sipsey, County Line, Rocky Hollow, Blount Springs, Arkadelphia, Lynns Park, Empire, Smoke Rise, Rickwood Caverns and Partridge Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Alabama.
